meanings.sent1: He walked arrogantly into the room, thinking he was better than everyone else.
meanings.sent2: She spoke arrogantly, looking down on others with a haughty attitude.
meanings.sent3: The cat strutted arrogantly around the house, as if it owned the place.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered arrogantly in the sky, ready to unleash their fury.
meanings.sent5: The bully laughed arrogantly after pushing the smaller kid to the ground.

meanings.definition: Showing an exaggerated sense of one's own importance or abilities
meanings.sent1: The arrogant man bragged arrogantly about his expensive car.
meanings.sent2: Her arrogant behavior made it difficult for others to work with her.
meanings.sent3: The arrogant peacock strutted around the farm, showing off its colorful feathers.
meanings.sent4: The arrogant mountain stood arrogantly among the other peaks, towering over them.
meanings.sent5: The arrogant CEO spoke arrogantly to his employees, belittling their efforts.
